head.title: A Wide-Open Expansion For an Eyewear Showplace

hedline.hl1: A Wide-Open Expansion For an Eyewear Showplace

abstract.p: For Eyes, discount eye chain, moves its sole Manhattan outlet to larger space (S)

block.p: For Eyes, a discount eyewear store with 124 locations nationwide, moved its sole Manhattan location from a shared space on West 23rd Street to a 10,000-square-foot showplace at 420 Lexington Avenue (between 43rd and 44th Streets) two months ago. Like the stores in Miami, Boston and Chicago, the New York For Eyes features frames by designers like Calvin Klein, Cynthia Rowley and Kenneth Cole, at discount prices. Their frames are sold with the proper lens as a complete set, starting at $59.95.

For Eyes, a discount eyewear store with 124 locations nationwide, moved its sole Manhattan location from a shared space on West 23rd Street to a 10,000-square-foot showplace at 420 Lexington Avenue (between 43rd and 44th Streets) two months ago. Like the stores in Miami, Boston and Chicago, the New York For Eyes features frames by designers like Calvin Klein, Cynthia Rowley and Kenneth Cole, at discount prices. Their frames are sold with the proper lens as a complete set, starting at $59.95.

For Eyes has an optometrist on site six days a week who can fit customers for glasses, sunglasses or contact lenses (daily wear lenses start at two for $49; four boxes of disposable lenses start at $69).
